item.title: Getting Started
item.description:
Welcome to BigLedger! This comprehensive business management platform combines powerful ERP capabilities with modern technology to help your business thrive.

What is BigLedger?

BigLedger is an integrated Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system that provides:

  • Financial Management: Complete accounting and financial control
  • Sales & CRM: Customer relationship and sales pipeline management
  • Operations: Inventory, procurement, and manufacturing
  • Human Resources: Employee and payroll management
  • Business Intelligence: Real-time analytics and reporting

Prerequisites

Before you begin, ensure you have:

  • An active BigLedger account
  • Admin or appropriate user permissions
  • Internet connection
  • Modern web browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)

First Steps

1. Account Setup

Create your BigLedger account:

  1. Visit BigLedger Platform
  2. Click “Start Free Trial” or “Sign Up”
  3. Choose your deployment option:
    • Cloud (recommended for most businesses)
    • On-premise (for specific compliance needs)
  4. Follow the registration process
  5. Verify your email

2. Initial Configuration

After your first login, the setup wizard will guide you through:

Company Information

  • Company name and legal entity
  • Tax identification numbers
  • Fiscal year settings
  • Base currency
  • Time zone

Module Selection

Choose which modules to activate:

  • Financial Accounting (recommended to start)
  • Point of Sales
  • Inventory Management
  • Customer Relationship Management
  • Human Resources
  • Project Management

User Setup

  • Create user accounts
  • Assign roles and permissions
  • Set up departments/teams
  • Configure approval hierarchies

3. Dashboard Overview

After setup, you’ll see the main dashboard with:

Key Performance Indicators

  • Revenue and expenses
  • Cash position
  • Sales pipeline
  • Inventory levels
  • Outstanding receivables/payables

Quick Actions

  • Create invoice
  • Record payment
  • Add customer
  • Create purchase order
  • View reports

Activity Feed

  • Recent transactions
  • Pending approvals
  • System notifications
  • Task reminders

4. Basic Operations

Start with these fundamental operations:

Financial Operations

  • Setting up Chart of Accounts
  • Recording journal entries
  • Creating invoices
  • Processing payments
  • Bank reconciliation

Sales Operations

  • Adding customers
  • Creating quotes
  • Processing orders
  • Managing pipeline
  • Tracking commissions

Inventory Operations

  • Adding products
  • Managing stock levels
  • Processing transfers
  • Running stock counts
  • Setting reorder points

Implementation Roadmap

Phase 1: Foundation (Week 1-2)

  1. Complete initial setup
  2. Import Chart of Accounts
  3. Set up tax configuration
  4. Add key users
  5. Configure basic workflows

Phase 2: Core Modules (Week 3-4)

  1. Implement Financial Accounting
  2. Set up customer database
  3. Configure products/services
  4. Test transaction flows
  5. Train core team

Phase 3: Extended Modules (Week 5-8)

  1. Add additional modules as needed
  2. Configure advanced features
  3. Set up integrations
  4. Customize reports
  5. Train all users

Phase 4: Go Live (Week 9+)

  1. Final data migration
  2. User acceptance testing
  3. Final training
  4. Parallel run (if needed)
  5. Full production launch

Training Resources

Self-Service Learning

  • Video Tutorials
  • Module Documentation
  • Best Practices Guide
  • Community Forum

Instructor-Led Training

  • Webinar series (weekly)
  • On-site training (available)
  • Custom training programs
  • Certification courses

Getting Help

Support Channels

  • In-App Help: Click the help icon for contextual assistance
  • Knowledge Base: Searchable documentation
  • Email Support: support@bigledger.com
  • Phone Support: Available for premium plans
  • Community Forum: Get help from other users

Best Practices for New Users

  1. Start with one module and expand gradually
  2. Use the sandbox environment for testing
  3. Document your processes
  4. Regular backups (automated in cloud)
  5. Stay updated with release notes

Next Steps

Now that you’re familiar with the basics:

  1. Explore Modules: Visit our Modules Overview to understand capabilities
  2. Review Documentation: Check module-specific guides for detailed setup
  3. Join Training: Register for upcoming webinars
  4. Connect with Community: Join our user forum
  5. Plan Your Implementation: Use our implementation templates

Quick Reference

Keyboard Shortcuts

  • Ctrl/Cmd + K: Quick search
  • Ctrl/Cmd + N: New transaction
  • Ctrl/Cmd + S: Save
  • Ctrl/Cmd + P: Print
  • F1: Help

Common Tasks

  • Creating Your First Invoice
  • Setting Up Products
  • Adding Customers
  • Running Reports
  • Month-End Procedures

Welcome to BigLedger - Your Complete Business Management Solution!
